Back in 2022, workers the Apple store in Towson, Maryland became organized the first formally recognized union at an Apple retail […]

item.title: Scammers found planting online betting ads on Indian government websites
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description:
Some Indian government websites have allowed scammers to plant advertisements capable of redirecting visitors to online betting platforms. TechCrunch discovered around four dozen “gov.in” website links associated with Indian states, including Bihar, Goa, Karnataka, Kerala, Mizoram and Telangana that were redirecting to online betting platforms. Some of those websites belong to state police and property […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Motional cut about 550 employees, around 40%, in recent restructuring, sources say
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Around 550 employees across autonomous vehicle company Motional have been laid off, according to information taken from WARN notice filings and sources at the company.  Earlier this week, TechCrunch reported that Motional is pausing commercial operations and delaying plans to launch a robotaxi service with its next-gen Hyundai Ioniq 5 robotaxis until 2026 as it […]

item.title: Founders Fund leads financing of composites startup Layup Parts
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
Scarcely five months after its founding, hard tech startup Layup Parts has landed a $9 million round of financing led by Founders Fund to transform composites manufacturing. Lux Capital and Haystack also participated. The breakneck pace is more than a subtle indication that investors’ appetite for tech-focused solutions to the woes of the American industrial base […]

item.title: Anthropic now lets kids use its AI tech — within limits
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
AI startup Anthropic is changing its policies to allow minors to use its generative AI systems — in certain circumstances, at least.  Announced in a post on the company’s official blog Friday, Anthropic will begin letting teens and preteens use third-party apps (but not its own apps, necessarily) powered by its AI models so long […]
